intro: Aquilegia navajonis, commonly known as Navajo monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Its flowers bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
